title: verify_api_health_check_endpoint
description: Test the /health GET endpoint to ensure the API is up and returns the correct status and version information without requiring authentication.

title: verify_csrf_token_retrieval
description: Test the /csrf-token GET endpoint to verify that authenticated users can successfully retrieve a CSRF token for form submissions.

title: verify_user_authentication_login
description: Test the /auth/login POST endpoint to validate user login functionality with correct and incorrect credentials, including optional userType parameter handling.

title: verify_user_registration_process
description: Test the /auth/register POST endpoint to ensure new users can register with all required fields and receive a valid token upon successful registration.

title: verify_product_creation_by_seller_or_admin
description: Test the /products POST endpoint to confirm that only authenticated users with SELLER or ADMIN roles can create new products with required fields and optional images and specifications.

title: verify_product_details_retrieval
description: Test the /products/:id GET endpoint to retrieve product details by ID, ensuring correct data is returned for valid IDs and appropriate errors for invalid or non-existent IDs.

title: verify_store_listing_with_filters
description: Test the /stores GET endpoint to list stores with various filtering options such as page, limit, search, verified status, city, and state.

title: verify_user_profile_update_with_csrf
description: Test the /users/profile PUT endpoint to update user profile information with valid authentication and CSRF protection, verifying that changes persist correctly.

title: verify_password_change_with_csrf_protection
description: Test the /users/password PUT endpoint to change user password, ensuring current password validation, new password requirements, and CSRF protection are enforced.

title: verify_admin_product_approval_workflow
description: Test the /admin/products/:id/approval PATCH endpoint to allow ADMIN users to approve or reject products with appropriate CSRF protection and audit logging, including handling of rejection reasons.
